newsitem.title: GERMANY: SKS Logistics Int'l plans Asia expansion.
newsitem.headline: SKS Logistics Int'l plans Asia expansion.

text.p: German freight forwarder SKS Logistics International GmbH said it foresees growing business with south-east Asia.
Gunter Jendricke, managing director of parent company Suedkraft Spedition GmbH, said the newly-formed SKS Logistics International will target air and sea freight activities in Asia.
The new shareholding in Singapore-based Rhenus Transport would allow SKS to profit from existing business relationships in the dynamic south-east Asia region, he said in a company statement.
"Through our stake (in Rhenus) we expect a strengthening of our strategic market position," he said.
SKS Logistics International was formed by Munich-based Suedkraft on July 1 to operate the forwarder's international air and sea freight activities.
It has offices at seven German locations and has a 49 percent stake in Bremen forwarder CC Cargo Contor Speditionsgesellschaft mbH and a holding in sea freight forwarder Safar N.V., Antwerp.
Suedkraft is a subsidiary of Kraftverkehr Bayern GmbH, part of the German building materials group Heidelberger Zement AG.
